original: Lindström, Harald Gustaf Åke, teol. dr, docent, lektor, Borås, f. 30/12/05 i Avesta av past. Emanuel L. o. Lydia Wagnsson. G. 41 m. tandläk. Inga-Britta’Elofson. Barn: Barbro f. 42, Margareta 44, Björn Åke 47. — Stud:-ex. v. Upps. h. a. 1. 24, fil. kand. 27, teol. kand. 32, teol. lic. 39, teol. dr 46. Lär. v. folkhögsk. 32-34, v. Skara h. a. 1. 39, v. Karlstads h. a. I. 40, v. Upps. h. eilem:lärov. o. gymn. f. fl. 41, v. prakt, me 11 an sk. 42. Förordn. t. do c. v. Upps. univ. 46, utn. t. lektor v. Borås h. a. 1. 47. Tjg. s. lär. v. försv. lärov. i Upps. 46-47. Ordf. i fria kristl. gymn :.rÖr. 33-37, dess resesekr. 33-35, ordf. i komm. f. Sv:e’S fören. kristl. stud :rör. sed. 43, i fria kristl. stud:-fören. i Sv:e sed. 44. Medl. av red:-komm. f. tidskr. Tro o. Liv sed. 42. Skr.: John Wesleys omvänd. (37), Wesley and Sanctification. A Study in the Doctrine of Salvation (46), art. i tidn. o. tidskr.
translated: Lindström, Harald Gustaf Åke, D. Th., lecturer, teacher, Borås, b. 30/12/05 in Avesta to Rev. Emanuel L. and Lydia Wagnsson. Married in 1941 to dentist Inga-Britta Elofson. Children: Barbro b. 1942, Margareta b. 1944, Björn Åke b. 1947. Studied: graduated from Uppsala University High School in 1924, B.A. in Philosophy in 1927, Bachelor of Divinity in 1932, Licentiate of Theology in 1939, Doctor of Theology in 1946. Worked as a teacher at folk high school from 1932-1934, at Skara High School from 1939, at Karlstad High School from 1940, at Uppsala High School and Gymnasium from 1941, and at a practical medical school from 1942. Appointed as a docent at Uppsala University in 1946, and as a teacher at Borås High School in 1947. Served as a teacher at the military school in Uppsala from 1946-1947. Chairman of the Free Christian Gymnastics Association from 1933-1937, and its travel secretary from 1933-1935. Chairman of the committee for the Swedish Association of Christian Studies since 1943, and the Free Christian Study Association in Sweden since 1944. Member of the editorial committee for the magazine "Faith and Life" since 1942. Writings: "John Wesley's Conversion" (1937), "Wesley and Sanctification. A Study in the Doctrine of Salvation" (1946), articles in newspapers and magazines.

memberOf.name: Free Christian Study Association in Sweden
